fields.description:
I've seen this is possible in software projects, but not business projects.

This would be handy to have in other non-software projects.
fields.summary: Allow card customisation in business projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The scrollbar snaps back up and down when dragging the scroll thumb vertically on any browsers on Windows OS.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Roadmap page on any browsers on Windows OS
 # Click and drag the scroll thumb up and down on the right side of the window

h3. Expected Results

Scroll thumb stays at the dragged position, Roadmap shows the issues within the scrolled position.
h3. Actual Results

Scroll thumb jumps up and down, Roadmap issues flicker.
h3. Workaround

Avoid dragging the scrollbar vertically, use mouse wheel for scrolling.
fields.summary: Dragging scrollbar vertically on Roadmap on Windows causes weird scrolling behavior

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automatic scroll while dragging and dropping issues from plan doesn't work properly

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Plan from Advanced Roadmaps
 # Populate it with enough issues to have to scroll to browse through the issues in the plan view
 # Drag an issue from the bottom to the top without using the scroll from the mouse/touchpad

h3. Expected Results
Automatic scroll should work so the user can drop the issue in the desired spot

h3. Actual Results
Auto scroll fails to a point that it almost doesn't scroll.

Video as example:
 [^ARScroll.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Scroll with the mouse wheel or touchpad at the same time while dragging the issue
fields.summary: Automatic scroll while dragging and dropping issues from plan doesn't work properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Columns and statuses don't match the template when creating Kanban projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Hit Create Project
 # Select Kanban template
 # Use Template
 # Select Company Managed

h3. Expected Results

Columns should match the displayed on the screen:
To Do
In Progress
Done
!image-2021-11-02-11-28-12-935.png!
h3. Actual Results

A workflow with the below columns is created instead:
Backlog
Selected for Development
In Progress
Done

!image-2021-11-02-11-31-01-291.png!
h3. Workaround

Update the workflow and columns to match the desired template.
fields.summary: Inconsistency on Columns when creating project from Kanban template.

fields.description: When completing the sprint, the *subtasks* which are in the *Done* state should be completed and the remaining *subtasks* should move to either the Next sprint or backlog while the *Parent* *issue* is not in the *done* state.
fields.summary: Subtasks only in In-Progress status move to next Sprint or Backlog

fields.description: As a customer, I'd like to have burn up report available for the Kanban boards.
fields.summary: Have burn up report available for Kanban boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a new issue, if the user does have the Edit Issues permission, the Epic Link field won't be populated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Give the permissions Browse Projects and Create Issues to a user;
 # Make sure this user is not added to the Edit Issues permission;
 # Impersonate the user and create an issue populating the Epic Link field.

h3. Expected Results

The Epic Link field will keep the value. (either that or an error message telling the user that he can't create Epic links because of lack of permissions)
h3. Actual Results

Even though the issue is allowed to be created, the Epic Link field won't be populated with any errors.
h3. Workaround

Give the Edit Issue permission to the user.
fields.summary: Epic Link is not correctly populated if the user does not have Edit Issues permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently it is not possible to automate the process of subscribing to send automatic emails on the time tracking reports. It would be great to have a  feature like this and also it would be great if an option to choose it user wise will be an added advantage.
fields.summary: Subscription method to automate email for time tracking reports

fields.description:
h3. Problem

At the moment there is no option to enable vortex once disabled.
h3. Suggested Solution

_Option to enable vortex once disabled_ 
h3. Why This Is Important

_At the moment transfer of products from one Org to another Org is not possible for the vortex is enabled in either of the Orgs therefore, we need to disable the vortex in order to proceed with the product transfer._ 

_Once disabled the Vortex, there has to be an option to enable it once the transfer is complete._
h3. Workaround

_no workaround found at the moment_
fields.summary: Option to enable vortex once disabled

fields.description: I need to filter the issues in order to only display the issues that I'm watching.
fields.summary: Add a filter for issues "Issues that i'm watching"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

GET to /rest/agile/1.0/board/<board_id>/sprint won't return the "total".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a GET to /rest/agile/1.0/board/<board_id>/sprint

h3. Expected Results

It should return the value "total" as appear an example [in this documentation.|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-board/#api-agile-1-0-board-boardid-sprint-get]
h3. Actual Results

It won't return the value "total".
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: GET to /rest/agile/1.0/board/<board_id>/sprint won't return the "total"

fields.description:
Sample URL where this can be seen:

https://customername.jira.com/browse/XYZ-111

Currently, links associated with an issue are sorted by the date/time that they were added (which is effectively arbitrary).  Issues from different projects are all mixed up in the list.

This is not an problem when an issue only has a few linked issues, but for larger issues with many linked issues, it can be challenging to view the list to determine if any links were missed, etc.

Current link list example:
 * DEF-456
 * ABC-123
 * DEF-777
 * DEF-778
 * DEF-123
 * XYZ-111
 * ABC-10
 * ABC-2

What it should look like, after sorting by key (alphabetically for project and then numerically for the issue number, so that 2 would come before 10 or 123):
 * ABC-2
 * ABC-10
 * ABC-123
 * DEF-123
 * DEF-456
 * DEF-777
 * DEF-778
 * XYZ-111

Note that the new view is sorted by date linked, but on the old view (?oldIssueView=true) the links are not sorted at all, not even by date linked - it is truly arbitrary as far as I can tell.
fields.summary: Links in an issue should be sorted by key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the Kanban board doesn't have Kanban backlog enabled, the Epic Panel toggle has to be always set to off.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Kanban board
 # Enable Kanban backlog and set the Epic Panel on
 # Disable Kanban backlog
 # The toggle will still be set to on in the background

h3. Expected Results

The Epic Panel should be set to off.
h3. Actual Results

The Epic Panel toggle remains active. 
h3. Workaround

Enable the Kanban backlog and set the Epic Panel to off and disable the Kanban backlog afterward.
fields.summary: Disabling Kanban backlog doesn't toggle the "Epic panel" off

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user votes for an issue, it doesn't show up immediately in the cards of a board. It takes a while to get updated despite showing correctly under the Backlog tab

[^Screen Recording 2021-10-29 at 16.51.31.mov]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View an issue.
 # Update for the issue.
 # Go back to the board and check the issue card.

h3. Expected Results

The number of votes should show up once it is updated for the issue. 
h3. Actual Results

The number will not show the updated value for a very long time. But we can see the updated value under the issue view as well as under the Backlog section.
h3. Workaround

Transition any issue to a different column, transition back and refresh the page. The vote field should be updated now.
fields.summary: The number of votes for an issue as well Checklist progress is not getting displayed immediately in the card after the update

fields.description:
!image-2021-10-29-14-23-35-810.png!

 

WHO MADE THIS STUPID USELESS CRAP???

I cannot 
 - copy part of link
 - it requres time after page loaded for replace normal link to this shit
 - af you add more than 1 link you must change EACH of the to a normal link! 

NO ONE USE THIS!!!! Stupid crap links!

Make them normal!
fields.summary: WAKE UP!!! Remove you useless link view!

fields.description: If a user attempts to reorder issues in an Advanced Roadmap plan but the sort order for the view is set to something other than Rank, the reordering has no effect. However, the user does not know why they can't reorder the issues. If fact, it appears that they can (they can drag and drop issues), but the changes do not stick. It would be nice to display a message to the user explaining that they cannot reorder issues unless the view is sorted by Rank.
fields.summary: Tell the user why issues in a view cannot be reordered when the Sort order is not set to Rank

fields.description:
Currently, we don't support showing epics in the deployments timeline. Considering the current functionality, we can only filter the issues within the respective Epics.

 !Screenshot 2021-10-29 at 8.59.24 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add "Epic" under the "Issue Type" drop-down in the "Deployment" page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Releasing a version with unresolved issues, no other unreleased version, and without selecting the radio button errors out.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have only 1 unreleased version.
 # Have unresolved issues on the version to release.
 # Try to release the version, without selecting the radio button.

!image-2021-10-28-11-05-57-953.png|width=492,height=186!
h3. Expected Results

Version should be released without errors, or with a explicit error message.
h3. Actual Results

Below error is displayed:

!image-2021-10-28-11-06-44-367.png!
{noformat}
Log reference: 4ee11ec6-c4f6-4631-933e-b86cd4234a69
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Ensure the radio button is selected before hitting Release.

Suggestion

The radio button to "Ignore and proceed with the release - there are no other unreleased fix versions available." should be auto-selected and locked in this case.
fields.summary: Releasing a version with unresolved issues, no other unreleased version and without selecting the radio button errors out.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When user's language is set to German, starting a sprint with Start Date and End Date picked with the date picker will throw an error as in the below example:

!2021-10-26_15h14_39.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Switch user profile language to German
 # Create a new sprint in a project
 # Start the sprint with the start date and end date

h3. Expected Results

With the dates selected from the date picker, the sprint should be started
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown that the Start Date and End Date are in the wrong format

!2021-10-26_15h14_39.png!
h3. Workaround

The current known workaround is to change the language of the user to English.
fields.summary: Date format incorrect error when trying to start a Sprint while the user's language is set to German.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using some special characters on the Epic name custom field, the Epic panel or any other panel that shows the epic name will convert that character into its HTML encoded tag. E.g.
|HTML encoded character|Special character|
|{code:java}
& {code}|&|
|{code:java}
> {code}|>|
|{code:java}
< {code}|<|
|{code:java}
' {code}|'|
|{code:java}
" {code}|"|
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue e.g. ABC-123
 # Write a text on the Epic name field e.g. Migration & Automation

h3. Expected Results

The Epic panel should simply display the text as a string since the Epic name field uses a [Default Text Renderer] e.g. Migration & Automation
h3. Actual Results

The Epic panel displays the text as a string but the character '&' is rendered in HTML encoded e.g. {code} Migration & Automation {code}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Epic panel renders certain special characters as HTML encoded characters

fields.description:
The Flag value does not appear on the New Issue View and only appears a red flag on the top.

The value can be seen in Old Issue View. It would be good If the Flag value can be seen in the new Issue view and the Flag value can be edited.
fields.summary: Showing/Editing Flag values in new Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating an epic that includes "&" or ">" inside the Epic Name field gets converted into {noformat}&{noformat} {noformat}>{noformat} from the Backlog > Epics panel

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Epics Panel from Backlog
 # Create epic with "&" or ">" inside Epic Name

h3. Expected Results
"&" or ">" displayed

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}&{noformat} {noformat}>{noformat} 
When you go and edit the name, "&" ">" displays properly in the field. Viewing the epic which displays Epic Name field to the right, also displays the "&" properly. Re-saving does not fix this.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating an Epic with "& and >" in it results in "& and >"in the Epic Name field

fields.description:
{color:#57d9a3}As a{color} Jira user, {color:#57d9a3}I want to{color} be able to manage upcoming sprints in Basic Roadmaps, {color:#57d9a3}so that{color} I can visually schedule my issues into new sprints.

*Background*
 * There is currently the ability to see sprints on the roadmaps view which relates to this issue: JSWCLOUD-17926.
 * This ticket is to determine the need to create and manage sprints from the roadmap view. 
 This can help users to have a planning view of sprints in the same way it can be done currently with Epics. 

a) what does "manage sprints" mean to you? 
 b) what goals you are trying to achieve by managing sprints on the timeline vs. the backlog
fields.summary: I want to be able to manage upcoming sprints in Roadmaps, so that I can visually schedule my issues

fields.description:
Currently, any user (non-administrative account) can use the "Find and add new apps" option to install apps into Jira Cloud from the Atlassian Marketplace.

As an administrator, it would be helpful to not only disable the "Find and Add new Apps", as we have on [this feature|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-21599] as well but to have the ability for Administrators to approve such requests for basic users.
fields.summary: Restrict the ability to add apps for Administrator only

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation is not able to render tabular format from the issue using smart values.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create tabular content in the issue description.
 # Create an automation rule to render this tabular format from the description field {{{{issue.description}}}} using Automation.

h3. Expected Results
Issue data should be rendered in tabular format

h3. Actual Results

Issue data does not get rendered in tabular format

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation does not render tabular format.

fields.description: In the Roadmap tab, I'd like to be able to filter issues by their priority.
fields.summary: Ability to filter by Priority

fields.description: In current kanban backlogs, only the status set in the backlog column is displayed, it would be helpful to add the possibility to show more statuses in this view.
fields.summary: Make it possible to add multiple statuses on the Kanban backlog from company-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently roadmap allocates only the work that can be done by a team member per sprint for an issue. But this is not true for the last sprint since there are no more sprints so roadmap allocates all the remaining work to that sprint making it go over capacity. The algorithm works the same way for Kanban teams as well. 
h3. Expected Results

The remaining work should not piled up in the last sprint. 
h3. Actual Results

The remaining work are allocated to the last sprint by design.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ability to consume the working days in all the sprints

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to move sprints using drag and drop. Rather, we should use the option move up every single time which is time consuming and annoying mouse clicks. 

It would be great if we can have a feature that will move the sprints up or down by just drag and drop.
fields.summary: Move sprints with drag and drop feature.

fields.description: Currently, in Advanced Roadmaps, the *Parent Link* field only supports a single value. However, under certain circumstances, Jira Administrators might need to link a child issue (Epic) to multiple parents (Initiatives).
fields.summary: Ability to add multiple values to the Parent Link field

fields.description: We would like the ability to search/filter by the Team field, which is populated from the Shared Teams list in Plans.  Currently we are unable to do this and instead have to label all of our issues with the team name so that we can organize which team is working which ticket.
fields.summary: Advanced Issue Search - Filter by Team

fields.description: Our organization continues to grow very fast and it is drastically increasing the number of projects that need to be created.  We are attempting to do an Advanced Roadmap for the entire organization but there are too many projects to view them all in the Advanced Roadmap (more than 100).
fields.summary: More than 100 projects in Advanced Roadmap

fields.description:
Hi Guys,


I'm quite flustered why a release is not just manages as an issue going through a certain workflow.
It fits perfectly above the epic-level hierarchy.

In our case releases pass a QA stage before being actually released.
So the way i see it:
unreleased -> in progressCategory
released -> doneCategory
archived -> doneCategory (actually should be cancelled in our case)

possible additional statusses:
Backlog
Cancelled
Blocked
QA
Beta

You get the idea, it would be nice to have freedom and the power of automation around a release 

have a nice weekend all!

Wim
fields.summary: Allow for custom states of a release and manage the workflow of a release as a whole

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the option to use the same queries on Quick Filters and Swimlanes (as JQL).
While setting up swimlanes, instead of re-creating the quick filter, have them available to be quickly added.
fields.summary: Board Configuration - Have the option to share JQL queries on Quick Filter and Swimlanes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When transition the issue from the board in JWM projects , it does not highlight the column.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # When transition the issue from the board in JWM projects

h3. Expected Results

It does not highlight the column when transition the issue however When we transition the issue from the board for Software projects,it does highlight the column.
 !JIRA work management.png|width=1524,height=174! 
 !JIRA software.png|width=924,height=395!
h3. Actual Results

JWM project board should also highlight the column as customer is expecting to see the feature.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When transition the issue from the board in JWM projects , it does not highlight the column.

fields.description:
When a user has license for only Jira Work Management, the user can have very limited access to Jira Software as well. Users get very generic errors while doing operations for which they simply don't have access. These generic error messages does not help in figuring out the cause of problem at all.

Another issue is getting an option to perfrom operation in UI when user does not have permission.

Few Examples:

*a)* *Error "We're having troubles connecting to your boards Jira"* : This error is encountered when a user with JWM license try to access JSW project Board. The does not provide any hints about wrong license in use or access issue. An error message like "You don't have a valid Jira Software License" to display boards would have been more appropriate.

*b)* *"Create" button available in UI* : Here users with JWM license still see create button to create board however it shows up an error before they can complete the process. Again it fails for permission reasons due to JWM license. When users does not have permission to create boards as they cant view list of projects in first place, the Create button itself should not show up for them.

Including these would save hours which are spent in troubleshooting simple issues.
fields.summary: Misleading Error when user does not have correct License for the product

fields.description: As a customer, I'd like to have the vote button available on the board cards, in this way we don't need to open the issue to vote for it.
fields.summary: As a customer I'd like to have the vote button available on the board cards

fields.description:
Hi,

it would be amazing if, through the "Browse Projects" permission, you can hide either the project from the project list.

Unfortunately, at the moment, even if you don't have the "Browse Projects" right you can see the entire list of projects (ok if they try to enter inside the board they will see an empty board, no issues, but it's an information that we don't like to share with everyone).

Thanks!

 

Fiorella (big Atlassian fan ;))
fields.summary: Hide project list

fields.description:
Organizational changes are good to be implemented in Kanban paradigm. 

Currently it's impossible to see and control tasks on timeline in the roadmap section.

We use Jira not only in sowtware development projects, but in projects of organizational changes too. It's crucial to see tasks and sometimes subtusks on timeline in such type of projects.

!image-2021-10-20-18-29-28-843.png!
fields.summary: Show tasks on Timeline of Roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Summary

_List all the labels with their usage count of a project in single search_
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: list all the labels with their usage count of a project in single search

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition:

In the Plans / Advance roadmap adding a field 'Resolution' is not possible.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Allow adding the 'Resolution' field to the Plans / Advance roadmap.
h3. Why is this important:

Providing a visual representation of the issues that need to be done or not.
h3. Workaround:

Created a custom field (text field) to act as the resolution field.

Copy the value of the resolution field to the custom field via automation (or even workflow post function).

Add the custom field to the plan as a substitute.
fields.summary: Adding a Resolution field to Plans / Advance roadmap

fields.description: There should be some way to view who edited a sprint name, begin, end, and also a history of who did this ESPECIALLY who closed a sprint. someone has "Completed" sprints on my team's boards before they were completed and there is no way to see who has done so.
fields.summary: There is no way to view who edited a sprint

fields.description: Currently with automation, DevOps smart value only supported with DevOps trigger. It would be great if we could support all types of triggers.
fields.summary: Development smart value should support all triggers

fields.description:
When you have defined an IP allowlist in your GitHub org, GitHub for Jira currently can not be configured correctly. When trying to add an org, you will get a message saying that you need to be an admin in the GitHub org, even though you are one.

The reason for this is that there seems to be a bug in GitHub's evaluation of IP allowlists. Even though the correct IP addresses are listed in the app's managed allowlist (so you don't have to enter them yourself), these IP addresses are blocked.

*Temporary workaround:*

Add the IP addresses 13.52.5.96 through 13.52.5.111 to your GitHub org's IP allowlist. Add each IP address individually and not as a CIDR range, because it doesn't work otherwise.

Note that this workaround is temporary, because the IP addresses our servers operate from may change in the future. The root cause of this problem has to be fixed by GitHub, because there seems to be a bug in their IP allowlist feature.

We have raised this with GitHub's support and will keep this ticket updated with new information.
fields.summary: GitHub for Jira does not work with a GitHub IP allowlist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, there is an issue impacting users who have Issues with only deployments, feature flags, or remote links associated and don't have an SCM provider with the create-branch capability.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect a Jira site to a provider with the Deployments, Feature-Flags, or Remote-Links capabilities
 # Associate a Jira Issue with one of the above development information types.
 # Go to the Jira Issue view
 # Click on one of the entries shown in the releases glance

h3. Expected Results
 * The user expects the development details dialog to open with the tab relating to the type of development information clicked in the releases glance.

h3. Actual Results
 * There is no dialog shown and no error listed in the console or on the page for the user to see.

h3. Workaround

A workaround is possible where a site admin can connect Bitbucket cloud or another provider with the create branch capability to the project.
fields.summary: Clicking on entries in the releases glance in the Issue View fails to open the Dev Details Dialog

fields.description:
By now, when selecting an Epic in Epic Link drop-down field of an issue, Jira shows Epics from other projects:

!image-2020-09-17-11-05-45-113.png|thumbnail!

It would be nice to have the possibility to enable a filter to consider only Epics of the same project of the target Task/Story/etc. just as it's possible to consider only issues that are not Done.
fields.summary: Possibility to restrict only Epics from the same project to be shown as option in Epic Link drop-down

fields.description: We want to be able to link a issue to multiple issues, some time a issue is required for multiple epics and we would like to be able to track that issue under all of them and one the issue is completed visualize the progress in all the epics.
fields.summary: Link Issue to Multiple Epics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*Only My Issues* quick filter not working as expected when the user switches from Active Sprints to Backlog with the quick filter selected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Active Sprint and select the *Only My Issues* quick filter.
 # Switch to Backlog, the *Only My Issues* quick filter will be selected however issues for all the users are displayed.

h3. Expected Results

The *Only My Issues* quick filter should filter issues for both Active Sprints as well as Backlog.
h3. Actual Results

The *Only My issues* filter the results for Active Sprints but not for Backlog when switching from Active sprints to Backlog with the quick filter selected.
h3. Workaround

The user needs to refresh the page after switching to backlog in order to have the quick filter *Only My Issues* effective.
fields.summary: Only My Issues quick filter not working as expected when the user switches from Active Sprints to Backlog with the quick filter selected.

fields.description:
Add the ability for Deploys and Pipelines from a Bitbucket repository that uses code from other repositories to link to Jira issues used on commits and branches in those other repositories.

When using a Bitbucket repository only as DevOps repository for pipeline and deployment of code generated on other Bitbucket repositories I would like that the Smart Links would link the deploys generated to the issues linked in the original commits from the original repositories of the code used.
fields.summary: Allow Deploys and Pipelines from Bitbucket using code from other repositories to link to issues from the original commits

fields.description: The feature of being able to see Issues and Sub-Tasks on the board, and collapse or expand, would be helpful.
fields.summary: Feature to collapse Issues and see sub-tasks on a Kanban board.

fields.description:
h3. Problem :

"New line" is replaced by "space" in the email received by an user who is invited to the site

 
h3. Steps :
 # Suppose the invitation to user is sent as below :
!image-2021-10-14-15-34-25-056.png|width=121,height=154!
 # The email user receives is as follows, 
!image-2021-10-14-15-38-21-948.png|width=152,height=141!

h3. Workaround

_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: New line is must be read when inviting user to site through personalized email invite.

fields.description:
Currently the date format on Simple Roadmap is set to YYYY/MM/DD and it is not configurable. 

Customers would like to ability to change the format to their preferred selected date format. For example: MM/DD/YYYY
fields.summary: Ability to change the date format on an Simple Roadmap plan

fields.description: At this time, there are no visual indications that an issue is a blocker or duplicate of another issue when looking at Boards. These indicators would be helpful when organizing work.
fields.summary: Provide better visual feedback on Jira cards (blockers, duplicates)

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently, Jira Cloud does not natively have a dedicated log for users to view each time entry per issue across a date range.
h3. Suggested Solution

Idea would be to include time logged as a searchable parameter for users, with the ability to sort by issues across a date range. 
 Admins and users should be able to export out a list of all time logged as well.
h3. Why This Is Important

This is important as not all customers would be willing to invest in a third party app solution and this information is already logged in Jira Software, it just needs to be made accessible.
h3. Workaround

Third party marketplace apps exist at this time that provide similar functionality.
fields.summary: Include a log of time recorded on issues as a feature in Jira Software Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching by "abc[" or simply "["at the quick filter search box breaks the page causing no other filter to work
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the backlog
 # At the search box, type anything like *abc[*
 # The URL will be updated with the search
 # Clearing the search results will not clear the URL
 # It affects other searches that stop working after the error even after hitting the "Clearing results" link.

h3. Expected Results

The filter should return the issues (or no issues if there's no match). Also, *clearing the results should clear the search from the URL and the page should allow using other quick filters.*
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the browser:
{code:java}
Invalid regular expression: /[/: Unterminated character class{code}
{code:java}
t @ batch.js?feature-kirigami-wrm-require-client-rewrite=true&locale=en-US:2069
r.safeError @ batch.js?feature-kirigami-wrm-require-client-rewrite=true&locale=en-US:2069
(anonymous) @ batch.js?feature-kirigami-wrm-require-client-rewrite=true&locale=en-US:5492
AsyncScheduler.js:45 Uncaught SyntaxError: Invalid regular expression: /[/: Unterminated character class
 at new RegExp (<anonymous>)
 at batch.js?feature-kirigami-wrm-require-client-rewrite=true&locale=en-US:5994
 at observable.js:28
 at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
 at s.trigger (observable.js:27)
 at s.applyFilters (index.js:82)
 at t.H [as _next] (apply-filter-epic.js:10)
 at t.__tryOrSetError (Subscriber.js:251)
 at t.next (Subscriber.js:191)
 at t._next (Subscriber.js:129){code}
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Quick filter breaks if searching for special characters "[" or "*" causing no other filter to work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

An intermittent problem that seems quite vague to reproduce occurs on Jira whereby the project pages on a Jira returns a 500 error when loading. The associated confluence page on the project page refuses to load and shows the below warning to contact support.

!support.png|width=522,height=244!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link a confluence space or page in Jira's project page
 # Revisit the page and it will display an error.
 # This problem seems to be hard to replicate in some instances.

h3. Expected Results

The associated project page show simply display the result
h3. Actual Results

A failure occurs due to →
{noformat}
could not map exception type org.springframework.transaction.UnexpectedRollbackException with message 'Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only' to a specific REST status. 
{noformat}
Defaulting to InternalServerError

Which results in 500 errors and a rollback is done

The below exception is thrown in the log
{noformat}
message: Performing rollback. Transactions:
  ->[null]: PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,ISOLATION_DEFAULT,readOnly (Session #1970057003)
   micros_container: confluence
   product: confluence
   thread: http-nio-8081-exec-4 [tenantId:d5a0dca1-21be-4ad4-8ac2-dd508e93a0eb, experience:unknown] [traceId:13986d0a37d244a4]
   time: 2021-09-24T13:12:16.870827535Z
   timestamp: 2021-09-24T13:12:16.870
{noformat}
On Jira, the project pages seem to be making a request to the *collab service* by request the URL for the page or space that has been linked
{noformat}
https://your-instance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/1655xxxx32/child/page?limit=200&start=0&expand=childTypes.page,history.contributors.publishers.users,history.lastUpdated,metadata.frontend.collabService
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Connect to another page or space in Jira’s project pages and reconnect the previous page again.

 * Create the space via Project pages in Jira. Then browse over to Confluence, and create a new page there, refreshing it in Jira.
fields.summary: Unable to access Jira's project pages

fields.description:
In order to utilize the teams created within Roadmaps, these need to be manually edited. 

I would like teams to be consistent across all boards. Treating teams within roadmaps and teams within projects limits automation options, adding additional work for POs. 

Ideally, I would like to create a rule that automatically assigns an issue to a team based on the assignee.
fields.summary: Company-Managed Projects - Roadmap Teams

fields.description:
This feature is currently available within Team-Managed Projects, and is a feature my team utilized quite a bit prior to migrating to Company-Managed Projects. Adding this option significantly reduces the amount of clicks involved with update project statuses. 

I would like to edit the status of an issue directly from the line item within the backlog, without clicking into the issue. 

Example: 

!image-2021-10-13-09-11-00-775.png!
fields.summary: Company-Managed Projects - Editable status within line items

fields.description:
For all items in the backlog, I would like to be able to see the total number of points in the backlog, similar to sprints when they have started. For example: 

!image-2021-10-13-09-06-14-120.png|width=137,height=55!

This helps our organization quickly see the overall points available within a backlog.
fields.summary: Company-Managed Projects - Add capacity to Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When changing the *Epic name* of an epic is not reflecting the updated epic name on the active sprint board. Epic label added to issues still shows the old epic name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic and add an epic name while creating an epic
# Assign an issue to the epic and add the issue to an active sprint
# On the *Active Sprints* board, the epic label shows the name of the epic (If epic labels are not displayed, click on *...* > Show epic labels)
# In Board settings, Swimlanes > Set swimlanes based on anything except *Epics*
# Go back to the epic and change its *Epic name*
# Go back to the board and refresh it

h3. Expected Results
The epic labels on the *Active sprints* board should display the updated epic name

h3. Actual Results
The epic label still shows the old epic name on the Active sprints board

h3. Workaround
Setting the board swimlanes to *Epics* updates the epic labels on the active sprint board
fields.summary: Changing the epic name of an epic is not reflecting the updated name on Active Sprints board

fields.description:
When editing a ticket’s Description (and other text boxes like comment, etc) the SAVE button is showing at the bottom of the box.

This results, mostly in the Descrip case, in the button being hidden and requires scrolling to get to. Each time I’m editing it’s a cumbersome task.

SAVE should be at the top of the box so that it isn’t pushed with the box and remains in the center of the view.

*Note:* Not sure if this ticket component is correct (they are too confusing!!!) so edit if needed
fields.summary: Editing text fields in Jira is a hard task! (saving the changes, that is)

fields.description: To be able to see an extra column showing x-ray test pass/fail results for each issue in a version as you cannot do this today.
fields.summary: Integrate test results in project release versions page as new column

fields.description: There are times that we may want to pick up an existing saved filter and adjust the columns to do some adhoc review. These adjustments to the columns are not meant to save back to the filter. However, once I hit "done", the saved filter will remember these filter columns setting which I do not want. Ideally, I would prefer the system to force me to "save" the filter again (just like changing the JQL filter) if I want to save any changes, including the columns.
fields.summary: Preview of selected columns on the search page

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to hide the Issue column on the plan, but it would be great to do that as we can already do with other columns:
 !ar-fr.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Hide the Issue column

fields.description:
In Team-managed projects (previously known as Next-gen) when you open the add epic option the list includes completed Epics and the status is not displayed in that list make it difficult to choose the correct Epic.

This behavior is expected as is a valid scenario to select completed Epics but it could be helpful to add the check/uncheck option to show or not completed Epics like in the Company-managed Epic link fields or at least add the status in the selection list to identify the completed Epics.
 !image-2021-10-12-12-44-21-519.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-10-12-12-45-14-975.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add option to exclude completed Epics from epic assignment through the issue breadcrumb

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Earlier the Automation audit log used to identify the condition which affected the performance of the automation by taking you to it when clicked on it. In other words, you could click on the link (like that highlighted in the attached) and afterward, it would immediately focus on that specific condition so that you can troubleshoot. This feature is not there anymore.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run an automation rule
 # Goto the audit log.
 # Expand any log, under Actions you have the various parts of the rule.
 # Click on any of the action details. !image-2021-10-12-22-58-00-577.png|width=1444,height=562!

h3. Expected Results

It should take you to that part of the Automation Rule.
h3. Actual Results

It is not taking you anywhere.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Automation logs do not point to the respective part of the rule.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can navigate between projects using different ways, such as the *Projects* option in the top menu, as well as using the quick search in the top right.

It seems that navigating from company-managed projects to a team-managed one will result in a broken web page.

Obs.: the problem seems easier to replicate when one of the company-managed boards that you navigate trough takes more time to load (it has more results than other boards).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Navigate to a company-managed board
* Navigate to a team-managed project trough the Projects menu or even the quick search (I was able to replicate the problem when navigating to the project through the *You work* page once as well)
 
h3. Expected Results

The board will load normally.

h3. Actual Results

The board either takes a really long time to load, or does not load at all (the web page will even stop responding).

Here are some recordings:  [^Team-managed board breaks.mp4]  [^Team-managed board breaks #2.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

If you access the URL of the team-managed board directly (even on a different tab) it does not seem to be affected:  [^Workaround - team-managed board load.mp4] 

Try saving the URL in the meantime.
fields.summary: Navigating to a team-managed project's board might break the web page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to assign an issue or browse a user field in a roadmap, when the issue screen has an additional tab.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any of the issues in the roadmap.
 # On the right-hand side, when trying to assign the issue, it does not respond.

!image-2021-10-12-14-17-39-364.png|width=223,height=160!
h3. Expected Results

Should be able to see the list of users and assign issues
h3. Actual Results

The list does not populate.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Either put the user field in the primary tab.

OR

Open the issue in a new tab and assign the issue.
fields.summary: Unable to assign issue or browse a user field in a roadmap, when the screen has an additional tab.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The capacity meters above the gantt can become misleading as there is no clear indication in the plan or documentation that each issue is calculated to be worked by a single team member at a time.

Under some scenarios the overload at the end of a period is marked as green instead of red.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Kanban plan
# Create a Kanban shared team with two members and with 80h of capacity per week (40h per member)
# Set the estimation unit as hours
# Add an issue that has an estimated cost of 20h
# Set the issue duration as 21 days (3 weeks)

h3. Expected Results
If the issue can only be worked by one team member at a time then the first week should show as 5/10d in green, the second week should also show as 5/10d in green and the third week should show overload with 10/10d in red. There also should be a clear indication that the issue is calculated to be worked by a single team member.

If the issue can be worked on by multiple team members then the load should be distributed evenly through the whole time period.



h3. Actual Results
The third week shows as 10/10d in green, which is misleading as it appears as if both members could work on the issue at the same time and the work is not being evenly distributed throughout the 3 week time period.

 [^Screen Recording 2021-10-06 at 11.50.55.mov] 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps capacity meters are misleading for overload

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using subtasks in a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project, those won't appear in the project issue when using the 'sprint in openSprints()' JQL operation.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project
 # Create a few issues with subtasks in the project
 # Go to the issue list view (PIN) and use the 'sprint in openSprints()' JQL operation

h3. Expected Results

Subtasks should show in the list of issues.
h3. Actual Results

Subtasks are not appearing in the list.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using the JQL sprint in openSprints() doesn't include team-managed subtasks

fields.description:
!image-2021-10-11-10-03-14-935.png|width=694,height=241!

 

You can sort by all kinds of useful thing, but not Rank for some reason.

Sorting by Rank would allow visibility into the order that the stories are being developed in - bonus if you can allow re-ranking from this view as well :)
fields.summary: Epic View - list of Stories, can it please sort by Rank

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Issue Detail View closes abruptly when creating or editing child issues on an Epic in a team-managed project backlog.

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* On a team-managed project, go to Backlog
* Enable the [Epic panel|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/manage-epics-in-team-managed-projects/#View-and-edit-epics]
* On one of the Epics in the backlog - click the *View all details* button - this would show the *Issue Detail View*
* Create child issues from the *Child Issues* section of the Epic

See screen recording:  [^team-managed-backlog.mov] 
 !team-managed-backlog-2.gif! 

h3. Expected Results
Issue Detail View should not close while creating child issues

h3. Actual Results
The view closes abruptly after creating a few tickets

h3. Workaround
No workaround available, - reopen the Issue Detail View

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Issue Detail View closes abruptly while creating or editing child issues on an Epic in a team-managed project backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The initial versions of the GitHub add-on used the OAuth connection, after migrating GitHub cloud users from DVCS to the connect app, the OAuth app was not deleted automatically.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # The issue can't be reproduced. We can verify if the DVCS connection exists.

h3. Expected Results
Jira should not call GitHub API using the DVCS connection.

h3. Actual Results
Old DVCS GitHub Connection used to access GitHub API.

h3. Workaround

Delete the GitHub OAuth credentials. On GitHub, remove the Jira application with OAuth connection.
fields.summary: Unused GitHub DVCS connections are using token with an outdated format to access the GitHub API.

fields.description:
Today, when cloning an issue in Jira it gets moved to the bottom of the backlog.

Would be good to have the cloned issue ranked directly below the source issue.
fields.summary: Cloned issue with rank similarly to the source issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
This endpoint [update sprint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-sprint/#api-agile-1-0-sprint-sprintid-put] doesn't work properly when updating some fieldsets as the completeDate updates to the current date time even though a different date time was passed in the payload.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sprint using this [endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-sprint/#api-agile-1-0-sprint-post]. This should create it in a future state
 # Then use the [update|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-sprint/#api-agile-1-0-sprint-sprintid-put] endpoint to update the sprint to an active state
 # Once that is done, try to update the state to a closed sstate using the below data

{code}
{
  "state": "closed",
  "name": "sprint 1",
  "startDate": "2020-04-11T15:22:00.000+10:00",
  "endDate": "2020-04-20T01:22:00.000+10:00",
  "completeDate": "2020-04-20T11:04:00.000+10:00",
  "originBoardId": 5,
  "goal": "sprint 1 goal"
}
{code}

h3. Expected Results
{code}
{
  "id": 37,
  "self": "https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/23",
  "state": "active",
  "name": "sprint 1",
  "startDate": "2020-04-11T15:22:00.000+10:00",
  "endDate": "2020-04-20T01:22:00.000+10:00",
  "completeDate": "2020-04-20T11:04:00.000+10:00",
  "originBoardId": 5,
  "goal": "sprint 1 goal"
}
{code}

h3. Actual Results
{code}
{
  "id": 37,
  "self": "https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/23",
  "state": "active",
  "name": "sprint 1",
  "startDate": "2020-04-11T15:22:00.000+10:00",
  "endDate": "2020-04-20T01:22:00.000+10:00",
  "completeDate": "2021-10-01T11:04:00.000+10:00",
  "originBoardId": 5,
  "goal": "sprint 1 goal"
}
{code}

The completeDate key seems to be ignored and follows the current date when the issue is updated. 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: REST API for update sprint doesn't work properly

fields.description:
Currently, for GitHub, the admins can set the permissions at the repository level. But users can link any issues to any of the repositories which is a security concern. 

*Suggestion:*

To include permission to allow users to perform Development operations on the issues of particular projects.
fields.summary: Add the ability to restrict the users to perform Development operations on Jira issues.

fields.description:
Introduce the ability to show week numbers instead of dates when choosing the range as *Weeks* the plan.

 !Screenshot 2021-10-07 at 14.22.39.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to see week numbers instead of dates in Advanced roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Cannot complete a sprint in a company-managed project if an issue previously on the sprint was moved to team-managed and converted from Task to Subtask.
 * When an issue is moved to another project, the *Sprint* value is copied across - JSWCLOUD-15615.
 * Also, changing the type of an issue from Task to subtask doesn't clear the sprint value of the subtask.
 * If the issue is a task and it's added to a sprint, the sprint value still remains in the Jira database after converting the type to subtasks, but it isn't visible in the UI. The only way to identify this is by searching for issues associated with the affected sprint.

h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a team managed, and company managed project
 # Create a sprint in both projects with a few tasks and start both sprints
 # Navigate to the company-managed project and select an issue.
 ## In the meatball menu, click 'Move'
 ## Set the target project as the team-managed project
 ## Set the new issue type to Task
 ## Finish the wizard with all default options
 # On the team-managed board, find the issue that was moved from the company managed and select it. From the meatball menu, click 'Move' again.
 ## This time keep the project the same (team-managed)
 ## Change the issue type to sub-task
 ## Assign a parent issue (preferably one in the current team-managed sprint)
 # Attempt to complete the company managed a sprint

h3. Expected Results

Sprint should complete successfully
h3. Actual Results

It shows a warning that the sprint can't be completed due to incomplete subtasks:
{code:java}
Sprint cannot be completed as there are incomplete subtasks on the following issues:
* <subtask_parent_issue_key>
{code}
h3. Workaround

Contact the support team to remove the broken reference.
fields.summary: Cannot complete a sprint in a company-managed project if an issue on the sprint was moved to team-managed and s converted from Task to Subtask.

fields.description:
Currently, the project list on the plan is ordered alphabetically when we use the *View Settings > Group By > Project* option. 

It would be awesome if we could re-order the projects on the plan:
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-06 at 17.51.15.png|thumbnail!  !image-2021-10-06-17-51-42-894.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Re-order the project list on the plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you click in the filter name, a loading animation shows up and then the list of tickets is not filtered and the quick filter is not selected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the quick filter and select a filter by clicking in its name
 !image-2021-10-06-11-38-52-106.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Filter is selected
h3. Actual Results

A loading animation shows up, but the list of issues is not filtered and the quick filter is not selected.
h3. Workaround

Select a filter by clicking on the checkbox
 !image-2021-10-06-11-41-03-639.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Quick filter doesn’t apply by clicking on the filter name (Backlog and Active Sprints)

fields.description:
*Problem Statement* : 

Validating Attachment during Transition. 

*Summary :*

Need to be able use Validator to verify if any attachment is added to ticket. If yes only then transition should happen. If not it should throw an exception. 

At the moment, per the current design, no matter attachment is added or not, transition will always throw an error. It works as expected if we add a screen during transition with Attachment field. it will be successful if user attach an attachment (on screen during transition) else it will fail. 

Conclusively validator configured for attachment _*does not validate pre-existing attachments*_ and works only when during transition we add a screen and then attach files. 

*Requirement:* 

Validator for attachment should also work like all other fields. It should not be necessary to attach attachment on screen during transition but it should validate pre-existing attachments as well.
fields.summary: Validating Attachment during Transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira randomly opens the view issue screen when an issue is transitioned and doesn't allow to write in the transition screen, this happens when the mouse is released inside the columns of the board and the column is just 1 issue height
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board that shows a few issues (preferable only one so the height of the column is 1 issue)
 # Add a transition screen from some statuses in the workflow
 # Transition the issue among the columns
 # If the click is released inside the column then sometimes the issue is shown along with the transition screen and there is no way to type in the textboxes from the transition screen.

h3. Expected Results

Only transition screen should be shown
h3. Actual Results

both the issue and the transition screen are shown

video attached.
h3. Workaround

release the click outside the column or add more issues so the height of the columns is more than one issue
fields.summary: Jira opens the view issue screen when issue is transitioned in board columns, and doesn't allow to write on the transition screen

Jira Software Cloud REST API endpoint GET /rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/reports always returns an error "Board with id xxx is not an agility board" for Company Managed projects (works in Team managed)

fields.description: When you have a company managed board with the simple roadmap feature disabled and you create a copy of that board Jira creates the copy with the Roadmap feature enabled, it should copy all the settings including the simple roadmap feature disabled.
fields.summary: Board settings do not get copied over when copying a company managed board

fields.description:
Similar to the ability to hide Epic Labels in the backlog view, users should be able to also hide Version Labels in the backlog view to give a more custom and clean view of the backlog.

!image-2021-10-04-11-15-59-641.png!
fields.summary: Ability to hide Version Labels in backlog view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the dependency view (lines or badges) in Advanced Roadmaps, sometimes it is causing performance issues due to the function that calculates dependencies.

h3. Expected Results

Dependencies should not cause performance issues.

h3. Actual Results

Sometimes, dependencies will cause performance issues.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dependency view impacts Performance in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the imputation summary, when clicking the button "Export to excel", a complete excel report can be downloaded successfully but the task titles on the first column are not linked to Jira web, is just text.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if next-gen Excel configuration would link each generated row to his web reference and allow jumping to the Jira site of the specific task by clicking on it.
h3. Why this is important

When showing a complete report of all the work that has been done during the week, the Excel is very helpfull, but it would be great to have a redirection to a specific Jira site on one click if extended information is needed.

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Excel export with linked task rows

fields.description:
We would like to have single documentation page that contain a matrix for Jira products based on features, functionality, benefits and constraints. There are consequences to decisions that are not known until teams are caught with Jira impeding smooth delivery.
We love to see a table/matrix detailing the functional differences/constraints to enable correct decisions when choosing between the following:

* Scrum projects VS Kanban projects
 
* Scrum boards VS Kanban boards

* Company-managed VS Team-managed projects

* The impacts of the above choices on the new Advanced Roadmaps/Plans feature
fields.summary: To have a single documentation page that contains a matrix for Jira products based on features, functionality, benefits and constraints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you opted in to create a new GitHub repository during the project creation flow, you will see your repository on the "Code" page in Jira Project.

However i you try to delete this repo from GitHub it won't be removed from the "Code" page.

Currently there is no way to remove it from the "Code" page even if repo was removed from GitHub
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Prerequisites:
 * Jira instance has [GitHub for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219592/github-for-jira?tab=overview] app installed 
 * There is at least one organisation connected to Jira via this app

Steps:
 # Go to "Projects" -> "Create Project"
 # Choose the "Kanban" project template
 # Click "Use Template" on the next Page
 # Click "Select a team-managed project"
 # Fill in the project name and key
 # Click next
 # Opt in for creating new GitHub repository on the next page

!image-2021-10-01-13-41-30-466.png|width=459,height=215!

8. Click "Connect" 

9. After the project and repository created delete the repository from GitHub

10. Go to the "Code" page. 
h3. Expected Results

The repository which was recently deleted is not there.
h3. Actual Results

 The repository is still on the code page.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: It is impossible to remove GitHub repository from code page if it was created during the "Create Project" flow

fields.description:
The customer would like to have an automation rule with a branch creation event coming from GIT and with that event assign the issue to the user who triggered the branch creation.

Currently, it is not possible since the Branch event creation is coming from an external source and not using an Atlassian account.
fields.summary: Allow external accounts using the GIT integration be the assignee for Automation rules.

fields.description: we would like to have a function in JQL that returns all the issues opened while a sprint is ongoing, so we can split issues that were moved from another sprint from the issues that were opened while the sprint was ongoing
fields.summary: have a function in jql that returns all the issues opened while a sprint is ongoing

fields.description:
If you change the issue type of one of the issues from Active Sprint to a Subtask issue type and map it under a different parent issue, even though the sub-task will be mapped under the sprint of its parent issue, still the active sprint can't be closed.

The error message that user's see on thie screen is as attached below:
 !Screenshot 2021-09-30 at 11.38.48 AM.png|thumbnail! 

- Because the mentioned issue in the error belongs to a different sprint, for users it is difficult to understand how the mentioned issuekey is associated with the current active sprint. So it would be a nice if we make the error meesage more clear and user-friendly.
fields.summary: Make the error message clear when users are unable to complete an active sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Performing JQL searches with development[] are not returning the expected results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Run the search *development[pullrequests].all > 1*, it will work. However, it only counts the PRs under the current status.

Example:
 * The issue has 2 *merged* PRs and 3 on *declined* status. The current status on the issue will be *merged*. If you search *development[pullrequests].all > 4* then no result will be returned but if you search *development[pullrequests].all > 1* then the issue will be returned.
 * The issue has 1 *merged* PRs and 1 on *open* status. The current status on the issue will be *open*. If you search *development[pullrequests].all >1* then no result will be returned but if you search *development[pullrequests].all > 0* then the issue will be returned.

h3. Expected Results

The search *development[pullrequests].all > 1* should count all PRs, independent of the current status.

h3. Actual Results

The search *development[pullrequests].all > 1* only counts the PRs under the current status.

h3. Workaround

None

  

The documentation [Advanced searching - developer reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-developer-reference-967312910.html?_ga=2.186660200.1998585794.1558533096-574287046.1513609148] does not inform if that's expected behavior or not, that's why we are raising it as a bug.
In case it is expected behavior, please update the documentation and change this bug report to an improvement request.
fields.summary: JQL search with development functionalities are not returning the expected results.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Custom created user picker field value was empty in the email notification however system field assignee has the value in the email notifications when Email from settings *${fullname} (Jira)* was updated to *${fullname} (**mycompanyname* *Jira)* under global settings.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

As a site Admin:
 # Navigate to the Global settings of your instance.
 # Update Email from *${fullname} (Jira)*  to *${fullname} (**mycompanyname* *Jira)*
 # Create a custom user picker field and assign it to a project.
 # Create an issue and change the custom-created user picker field value.
 # Custom created user picker field value is null in the triggered email notifications

h3. Expected Results

_Custom created user picker field value display the updated value in the triggered email notification_
h3. Actual Results

_Custom created user picker field value is null in the triggered email notification_
h3. Workaround

_Update Email from settings *${fullname} (mycompanyname Jira)* to *${fullname} (Jira)* under Global settings._
fields.summary: Custom created user picker field value was empty in the email notifications when Email from settings updated to  ${fullname} (mycompanyname Jira) from ${fullname} (Jira)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Avatars are in shown in wrong layout on any board when reducing or increasing the webpage of site.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # When we reduce or increase the size of web page browser

h3. Expected Results

The Avatars should be properly placed next to the search field.
h3. Actual Results

The Avatar's placement is changed when reducing or increasing the size of the webpage.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Avatars are shown in wrong layout.

fields.description:
I have an 'advanced roadmap plan' that displays multiple 'projects' together. I am using 'projects', each with its own dedicated board to reflect the work necessary to create a product we sell to end users. The work in each 'project' is completed by multiple teams, each team is a group of people with a similar skill set, each team works on multiple 'projects' at any given time.

However the advanced roadmap 'shared teams' associated with this 'plan' can only have one 'issue source' (therefore one 'project'). When using the 'Sprint Capacity Management' view in the 'plan' this means each team has their 'capacity' associated with only a small part of the work they need to complete in any given time frame. 

I would like the ability to associate one advanced roadmaps 'shared team' with all the 'projects' in a 'plan' so I can manage team capacity across projects.
fields.summary: Multiple Issue Sources for Advanced Roadmap Shared Teams

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The question mark icon next to Unmapped Status (board configuration > columns) displays a message when hovering it over with the mouse:
{code}
"Issues in these statuses wont show on the Kanban board or Kanban backlog"
{code}

This occurs even if the Board is configured as Scrum.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Kanban board
 # Access the respective board
 # Click on board settings
 # Click on Columns
 # On the right side, hover your mouse over the question mark icon next to *Unmapped Statuses*

h3. Expected Results
Message should be adjusted to the board type.

h3. Actual Results
Message refers to wrong board type.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Question mark icon next to Unmapped Status refers to Kanban even for Scrum boards

fields.description: Currently, on the "GitHub configuration" page in Jira, under the column "retry", we can run a "full sync", that will backfills all PRs from the past. But the sync currently does not update builds and deployments, it only updates the commits, branches, and pull requests.
fields.summary: Update builds and deployments when a sync is run

fields.description:
h2. Problem

To sustain a good overview in the backlog, a PO needs least possible whitespace between BL cards. 
Today, when including more fields in the card layout it doubles the card size, regardless of the additional fields' physical size. This compromises overview significantly.
h2. Proposed solution

Limit the width of the summary field, so that any additional fields added to the card can be included next to summary, rather than underneath.
fields.summary: Reduce backlog card layout size when extra fields are included

fields.description:
I would like to be able to see the Roadmap view for multiple team managed projects at the same time.

I'm aware of Advanced Roadmap but that only works for company managed projects which I consider to be deprecated and difficult to use.

The roadmap feature in team-managed projects is very nice and being able to see multiple projects at the same time in that view would already be very beneficial.
fields.summary: Roadmap for multiple team managed projects
